website_summaries.verdict: A favorite among coaches, this Louisville Slugger Fungo bat is an exceptional choice for hitting  fly- and ground-balls. Keep in mind it is a fungo bat, meaning it's meant for practice only.
pros: You may notice the handle is slightly discoloured from the natural finish of the barrel
This is because its been sanded down to provide a better grip, which works exceptionally well, no raw hands after using this bat
cons: The open grain of the ash wood will split overtime
We suggest covering the barrel with tape for a longer lifespan

customer_reviews.title: Puts the fun in fungo.
customer_reviews.text: Good fungo for the price. Does everything I need it to as a high school baseball coach. The only weakness is that it is made of ash and the grains will eventually split because it’s an open grained wood. This can be negated by taping the barrel of the bat and should las several seasons. Pair this with a nice grip and it’s almost perfect. I suggest lizard skins brand grip. Bottom line: for a low price it’s a great fungo, nothing beats the sound feel and handle of a wood fungo. If you want a better longer lasting wood look at a maple(or other closed grain woods) fungo.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Really nice bat
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how awesome this thing is. I have coached youth softball and baseball for nearly 10 years and I have always just used a players bat for hitting balls for infield practice. I am currently coaching a 9-10 year old baseball team. I have a bucket of about 50 baseballs and with this bat I can go through the entire bucket time after time after time hitting very accurate grounders, line drives, and pop flies anywhere on the field I want. I absolutely love this bat.
customer_reviews.author: A Raines

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is an official Major League Baseball bat that is 36” long. It was longer than I expected but it probably stated that in the description and I did not read through it....so thats my fault. It’s very well made, just the right weight, sanded so there is no splintering and perfect for what I needed it for.....home protection. If you are looking for a wooden bat that will meet all the requirements of a bat I highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: So much better than using conventional bat
customer_reviews.text: Whoa, this thing’s FUN. Guess I should act all cool hitting endless grounders and pop ups to grandkids, but it’s just fun to do it so easily that I keep grinning like a kid myself. Always just used a normal bat when coaching Little League. Now I realize I should have had one of these! Was worried about breaking it when first received because it’s pretty slender and light, but it’s holding up great. Not nearly as tiring to go through a bucket with this thing. A simple pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Shooter

customer_reviews.title: Not a good piece of lumber, poor quality overall.
customer_reviews.text: I just received and opened the K100. I have not had to purchase one in a few years. As the pictures show in this review, the life of this bar will not be long. Horrible piece of lumber. Too many grooves, the dip that was performed above the handle was not done well. Event the logos that were stamped are not embedded into the lumber as usual. I have coached for several years and I’m not an amateur when swinging it. I give this lumber a month.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Solid with modifications.
customer_reviews.text: This bat is stout!! In terms of Fungos it’s one of the largest I’ve ever used. That being said I’ve bought a new one very year up to this point because they break. I don’t think this one is breaking. First thing I did was drill a 7/8 hole in the barrel to lighten it up a bit. It’s solid but if you plan on swinging for 2 hours at a time you better be a big boy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonkey

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, great practice tool
customer_reviews.text: Solid fungo, great for hitting hard grounders and exerting minimal efforts during practice (youth baseball in my case). Fly balls take a little practice, but you get much more distance easily. If you don't want to hit so far, just choke up a lot and it's still light and balanced. When hitting to adults, this fungo will allow you to go maximum speed without significant effort.
customer_reviews.author: B. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Fun is right
customer_reviews.text: LOL, I never knew a bat could be fun. Guy at work said I should try one when I mentioned how tiring practice could be. This is great. I can just swat balls to wherever I want. I can send the kids backpedaling to the fences, give them fly balls way up in the sun, or just bop a few dozen grounders with ease. Should have gotten one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: ericaz

customer_reviews.title: Halloween perfection
customer_reviews.text: Yeah yeah I know... I know... I destroyed a perfectly good bat... IF it makes you feel better, it was very hard to destroy. Took me two days of sanding just to make it look aged. Super quick shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Becca P-TX

customer_reviews.title: Splinter giver
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as something to keep in my truck/office I realize that most people put tape on their bat for extra grip so Sanding may not be a big deal to those. But as I was removing the bat from the packaging I received a good size splinter. I later sanded down the bat and added tape so that problem is fixed. I expected slightly better quality but I'm pleased overall with the Bat. the Weight is nice and I feel good Holding it
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Beam

customer_reviews.title: I've used fungos for over twenty years. These new ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used fungos for over twenty years. These new models have a larger barrel, which improves my ability to launch rockets at my infielders! :)
customer_reviews.author: Frank Effler Jr

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed in the quality. I doubt it makes it through one season. I should have spent the extra 10 bucks on something else. Very disappointed in the quality buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Flanery

customer_reviews.title: Possibly rejects are being sold as high quality bats
customer_reviews.text: I just received two of these bats. Both of them have logos that are defective. Please see the images. The letters are scratched off on some. Others are printed off the mark. I’m disappointed in these. I think the seller is selling rejects.
customer_reviews.author: Soccer Mom

customer_reviews.title: Heavy fungo 30 oz weight
customer_reviews.text: It weights 30 OZ, much heavier than standard fungos like Easton MLF6 and MLF5 Fungo bats. Not sure why several reviewers here claimed its light weight, very misleading to me. The quality is OK, remember with a cost of $30 you get what you paid. The other thing bothers me is the bat butt is too big to hold. I returned it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I hollowed out the barrel a little with a 1” Forster bit and got it down to about 23 oz. it was pretty heavy. It comes with an unfinished handle, which I didn’t care for, but the price is right and it does it’s job. If you’re hitting flyballs all day you’ll be tired and should go with an aluminum. The reviews saying that the bat delaminated are false. It’s not a laminated bat, it’s solid wood. The wood grain had split on those bats, and probably could be fixed with glue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid fungo
customer_reviews.text: This bat is a little heavier than it should be, but works well. It will do everything you want it to. I have used this bat for and hour without fatigue, and it has good feel in the hands. The finish leaves something to be desired at the handle, but with light sanding or grip tape it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Kent

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend...
customer_reviews.text: Cannot recommend. Too long. Horrible feel. Cracks and there are strips pealing off inside 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good 1-season fungo bat
customer_reviews.text: Good while it lasted. Unfortunately this bat only lasted me about 5 months of actual work. Bat splintered during my practice today, and the barrel was taped up pretty well, but still cracked. Good bat for the price, but don’t expect multiple seasons out of it
customer_reviews.author: Jay Jones

customer_reviews.title: As expected but doesn’t come with plastic wrap on it
customer_reviews.text: It’s as advertised. No obvious defects or chips in mine, but it doesn’t come wrapped at all which is surprising to me as others do. Just a sticker. Or maybe mine was a customer return who knows? It does the job. Heavier than aluminum as expected.
customer_reviews.author: CC✨👩🏻‍🍳✨

customer_reviews.title: Well Made But Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t a traditional shaped fungo bat and I didn’t gather that from the description, or it wasn’t obvious to me. It’s not near as thin and weighs more than a typical fungo. It is well made, but I have to work too hard to hit balls to the outfield. Now, I’m getting up there in age and this may not be an issue for some.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy D. Caudle

customer_reviews.title: Swinging away at intruders rather than pitches
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say I bought this with visions of the movie the ‘Natural’ but I honestly bought it to use against anyone that may choose to break in.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Home Defense
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize the bat handle was unfinished. I'll be honest, this is for home defense and getting a raw-handled bat was a bit of a surprise. It took a bit getting the right bat tape, but it does what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool, Don't Hesitate - No Regrets.
customer_reviews.text: The price point probably got your attention. This is a very good tool - I have hammered hundreds of balls in a very short period of time. I painted the bat which definitely helped it. A few hits off the tip caused some splintering, taped up the barrel with duct tape after that. Should have done that initially, that also makes a significant difference. Hit the sweet spot, stay off the tip and shaft - enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: WG

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a good value so far!
customer_reviews.text: Great bat for the price. Hit over 400 fly balls with it so far. It performs as expected. I did put some lizard skin tape on it for a better grip. I wouldn’t expect a grip with this bat at this price though.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Price is Right but You Get What you Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for its price but don't use it. Too heavy and the grain is rough, so not awesome to hold. Works for its purpose but not anything to write home about. I do like Slugger bats though, just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Jones

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy and no pop
customer_reviews.text: Bat is extremely heavy and has no pop. Supposed to be 16 ounces. Weighed it at 27 ounces. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cacal

customer_reviews.title: Not we’ll balanced and way too heavy
customer_reviews.text: For what it is it’s a good fungo bat however, the more I use it and after using other fungo bats I’ve realized I will be spending more money on a lighter tougher bat. After an hour of hitting fungo my wrists are killing me. Not a bad purchase not a Great one either.
customer_reviews.author: Micah McNeely

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Satisfying Crack on Contact
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my son. We have played baseball with it several times, and it always makes us smile when we land that solid hit on the baseball.
customer_reviews.author: jp2code

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice bat
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice bat. It made entirely of wood. it's not a metal bat, so it's a bit heavier. Good craftsmanship and nice finish.
customer_reviews.author: Sdheydio

customer_reviews.title: Way too heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself as I coach 2 teams and hit hundreds of ground balls pop fly’s a week, and it was super heavy. I went w a Bownet and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Victor A Madrid

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Went with the original bat company. No complaints. Great investment for parents or coaches.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Good for coach
customer_reviews.text: Great fungo bat for coach. Is not heavy like other fungos so it's easy to swing. Can really hit good pop flys and ground balls. Just added some medical tape to the handle and was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy

customer_reviews.title: I love this bat!
customer_reviews.text: Great little fungo! You'll need to either wear batting gloves or add a grip, as I did, in order to save your hands. Great feel, heavy enough to make hitting pop flies more consistent. Great value. I will see how it lasts over time and update later.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Blunt

customer_reviews.title: Just don't
customer_reviews.text: Bat looked good but on 4th hit at practice it split, guess I got a bad one
customer_reviews.author: Water life

customer_reviews.title: It's "A Walking Dead" symbol
customer_reviews.text: My son enjoys the characters of the walking dead he has collected almost everything thing from each one of them that defines them. A few years ago he received a "Lucille" bat, but decided he would like to make an original one from the movie. I know crazy, but that's how much he has enjoyed the show. Btw, he is over 21.
customer_reviews.author: Chere Sellers

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love my fungo! Can't believe I've been a coach for 10 years without one.
customer_reviews.author: doogalus

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It’s a bit heavy so infield work may require a water break but as far as the outfield is concerned she’ll getR done. Get some decent batting gloves cause that handle is unforgiving and keep your swing compact (it’s gonna help)
customer_reviews.author: Earl T. Dynamite

customer_reviews.title: My kind of bat
customer_reviews.text: Coach high school ball, I like this fungo because it has a bigger barrel, it's end loaded and heavier than most fungos. I choke way up and hit precise fly balls and can hit really hard shots or bombs when I need with a full swing. Yea it's heavier but I just choke up get more control and can still hit any distance or shot you need. I like the tapered end too
customer_reviews.author: deon paz

customer_reviews.title: Nice buy
customer_reviews.text: Came fast and works well. The barrel is a little rough but overall a good buy. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Better than many far more expensive bats
customer_reviews.text: Feels fantastic right out of the gate. Good size too!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for home defense
customer_reviews.text: The fungo has long been known as a coaches bat but it also provides excellent reach when defending your home.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainBeefheart

customer_reviews.title: No thanks
customer_reviews.text: I returned this because it has a prop 65 warning.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Mankin

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. Great for value!
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all. Use this for my sons little league team. Had to put a grip on the handle the wood is a little unforgiving. For around $25 this was a great deal compared to other fungos. I think it’ll last me at least two seasons if I dont Abuse it. Probably much more
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Fungo bat
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a season. worked well on big field. Just put some tape on barrel and a cheap grip and your set. Will be using it again this season.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I haven’t had this bat for less than one season and it is starting to delaminate
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had this bat for less than one season (I have had it just over a month) and it is starting to delaminate. Spend the extra few dollars and buy a Easton.
customer_reviews.author: Cale Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Nice fungo for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Nice ash fungo bat and a great price. Would buy again if this one loses its "go".
customer_reviews.author: Tom Ace

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy fungo bat. Probably won’t use. It's closer to the stated shipping weight of 1.75 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Richard Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Successfully Accomplished Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Killed a Midnight Intruder. I have purchased additional bats for friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Rory S

customer_reviews.title: Good for price!!!
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for a baseball youth coach. He said it’s a lil heavier
customer_reviews.author: Capre

customer_reviews.title: The crack of wood
customer_reviews.text: I have use this fungo bat extensively. It has caused some discomfort in my hands. But it has been awesome for the amount work I have put in with it. I love crack and feel of the wood. It has reconnected me with my baseball youth.
customer_reviews.author: Halas Jennings

customer_reviews.title: just a longer standard bat
customer_reviews.text: Instead of lightening the bat they just made it longer (36") to give it a lower drop number. So now you have a standard 28 oz bat that's too long for most people to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Rosengarth

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for hitting balls to aspiring baseball players
customer_reviews.text: Just as pictured. It is perfect for hitting balls to aspiring baseball players. Not too heavy but gets the job done much easier than using a regular bat.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: My husband coaches my sons little league and says this bat is the best purchase ever. It allows him to easily hit ground balls and pop flies on demand.
customer_reviews.author: smatrose

customer_reviews.title: What a let down...
customer_reviews.text: Bat started to come apart after only a handful of uses. Wouldn’t recommend it if you want a bat to last
customer_reviews.author: IndyNova

customer_reviews.title: Good practice bat
customer_reviews.text: Handle is a little rough and needed grip tape. Will be fine for a few reps as is, but hitting a few buckets of pop flies will definitely leave your hands a bit raw.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Finch

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy for a fungo. Did not think to check the weight. Hope my friend uses it. It was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Gifter

customer_reviews.title: Really glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Just needed a fungo for my team, and this works really well. Really glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great for coaches
customer_reviews.text: This bat is great for coaches of baseball teams. Good price and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I used this to hit ground balls daily and the barrel started chipping in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler W.

customer_reviews.title: but love the sound of wood when hitting flys and grounders
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy compared to the aluminum versions, but love the sound of wood when hitting flys and grounders.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Snapped easily
customer_reviews.text: Broke during the first game. I don’t feel like I’m Barry bonds or anything so I don’t understand why it snapped so easily
customer_reviews.author: Shaquan_ransom

customer_reviews.title: too heavy
customer_reviews.text: this bat is nice for hitting limited amount of pop flies. But it is too heavy for infield or long outfield sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L.

customer_reviews.title: Tape it
customer_reviews.text: Most cost effective fungo I could find. Just tape up the sweat spot to prevent splintering.
customer_reviews.author: AndyRooneysEyebrows

customer_reviews.title: Great practice and warm up bat
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for hitting in field and pop fly balls for practices and warm ups before games. Good control and consistent hits.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Stiles

customer_reviews.title: What I do not like is the finish
customer_reviews.text: Least expensive Fungo I could find. Have not used it on the field yet, however, seems well weighted. What I do not like is the finish, the handle is a bit rough and the barrel is worse. Funny that the bat is labeled with a $29.99 price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Heavier and sturdy feel
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than my previous bamboo fungo, but still easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Don Nimura

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Was looking around for a good fungo bat for baseball practices and this is by far the best bang for your buck your going to find. It may be a little heavier than other fungos but made out of great quality wood and haven’t had any problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Cole D'Haese

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Definitely cheaper than the retail stores. Very nice hitting FUNGO
customer_reviews.author: HeathBAllen

customer_reviews.title: Makes practices/warmups easier
customer_reviews.text: This makes softball practices so much easier. I'm not killing my arms hitting pop flies anymore. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Mariaht325

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Crappy quality you get what your paying for. Too heavy and unbalanced to be a fungo bat
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Every coach should have one.
customer_reviews.text: I love my fungo. I dont go home tired after hitting ball to my team any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Súper heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Heaviest fungo I’ve ever came across. Thing is a log!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Pineda

customer_reviews.title: Good Wood
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed a wooden stick to hit groundahs....
customer_reviews.author: M. Maroney

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted the broke
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 6 games then the wood started to split and the cracked after 7 games work well when it lasted
customer_reviews.author: Ayrton love

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Bat
customer_reviews.text: As a coach helps me out a lot. Will purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Specialized bat as advertised
customer_reviews.text: My one comment about the bat is that I needed to sand the handle in order to avoid getting splinters. Otherwise it was as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent J. Festa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: it took some getting used too but works well ,ordered a 36 was sent a 39 but still works
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... coached for more than a decade and this is best fungo I have purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have coached for more than a decade and this is best fungo I have purchase
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Nice bat
customer_reviews.text: Nice bat. A little heavier than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Warner

customer_reviews.title: Great bat
customer_reviews.text: Used to hit ball for the dog, I think he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Good bat.
customer_reviews.text: Good bat does exactly what I wanted it for. Heavier than what I expected, but still good.
customer_reviews.author: Horacio Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Fungo love it. its light and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a lot heavier than I expected. If I could have swung the bat before purchasing, I would not have bought the bat. Other than that, it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Daddy2011

customer_reviews.title: but a very good value. Make sure you tape it up so ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than many fungo bats, but a very good value. Make sure you tape it up so that it doesn't splinter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Custome

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good bat
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good bat, however the hitting space is a little small so if you're looking for a bigger hit space go with a different style
customer_reviews.author: Gavin A.

customer_reviews.title: Good price and does what it needs to
customer_reviews.text: Good price and does what it needs to. You’ll definitely need to add a grip to it, the sanded bottom Can leave your hands a little raw after swinging for awhile. It felt a little heavy at first, but after a week, the weight won’t feel like an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Corey L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This bat helped me with my swing. My name is Anthony Rizzo.
customer_reviews.author: Goody

customer_reviews.title: Not only did the bat get here a day late ...
customer_reviews.text: Not only did the bat get here a day late. It's really heavy. I have a rawlings fungo. That is heavy. I don't need two. This will more then likely going back
customer_reviews.author: bigbounce4321

product_meta.title: Louisville Slugger K100 Ash Wood Fungo Bat
product_meta.description: No need to wear yourself out hitting ground balls and fly balls to your team. Louisville Slugger fungo bats are specifically designed for coaches to easily hit ground balls and fly balls for infield or outfield practice. The unique shape and end-weight design of Slugger fungo bats make them lightweight and extremely easy to swing without wearing out your arms, delivering extra distance even with easy swings. Northern white ash material is strong and flexible. Lightweight design and natural wood finish. Bat Specifications Wood: Northern White Ash Barrel: 2 1/4" Barrel Load: Endloaded Turn Model: K100 Warranty: Wood bats carry no warranty or guarantee Size: 36"
